Create a sketch with two faces (face\\_1 and face\\_2) and the following loops and lines/circles: * Face 1: + Loop 1: - Line 1: [0.0, 0.02] to [0.25, 0.02] - Line 2: [0.25, 0.02] to [0.25, 0.13] - Line 3: [0.25, 0.13] to [0.0, 0.13] - Line 4: [0.0, 0.13] to [0.0, 0.02] * Face 2: + Loop 1: - Line 1: [0.25, 0.0] to [0.75, 0.0] - Line 2: [0.75, 0.0] to [0.75, 0.15] - Line 3: [0.75, 0.15] to [0.25, 0.15] - Line 4: [0.25, 0.15] to [0.25, 0.02] - Line 5: [0.25, 0.02] to [0.25, 0.0] - Line 6: [0.25, 0.0] to [0.25, 0.0] Scale the sketch by 0.75 and extrude it with the following properties: * Extrude depth towards normal: 0.05 * Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0 * Operation: Create a new solid body Part 3: Cylindrical Hole Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 180.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0245, 0.0465, 0.13] Create a sketch containing the following: * Face 1: + Loop 1: - Circle 1: [0.0125, 0.0125] with radius 0.0125 Scale the sketch by 0.025 and extrude it with the following properties: * Extrude depth towards normal: 0.113 * Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0 * Operation: Join with existing body or add material Confidence: 95%</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Cylindrical Object with a Tapered End Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.3067, 0.3067, 0.0] Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. Within the sketch, create a single circle with the following properties: * Center: [0.0683, 0.0683] * Radius: 0.0683 Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch. Apply a uniform scale of 0.1366 to the sketch. Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis to a depth of 0.4092 to create a cylindrical object with a tapered end. Part 2: Cylindrical Object with a Flat Top and Bottom Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. Within the sketch, create two concentric circles with the following properties: * Circle 1: + Center: [0.375, 0.375] + Radius: 0.375 * Circle 2: + Center: [0.375, 0.375] + Radius: 0.2662 Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch. Apply a uniform scale of 0.75 to the sketch. Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis to a depth of 0.155 to create a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom. Part 3: Rectangular Prism with Vertical Ridges Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0417, 0.292, 0.155] Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. Within the sketch, create a rectangle with the following properties: * Line 1: + Start point: [0.0, 0.0] + End point: [0.0517, 0.0] * Line 2: + Start point: [0.0517, 0.0] + End point: [0.0517, 0.1741] * Line 3: + Start point: [0.0517, 0.1741] + End point: [0.0, 0.1741] * Line 4: + Start point: [0.0, 0.1741] + End point: [0.0, 0.0] Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch. Apply a uniform scale of 0.1741 to the sketch. Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis to a depth of 0.155 to create a rectangular prism with vertical ridges. Part 4: Cylindrical Object with Tapered Top and Bottom Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.6798, 0.3428, 0.155] Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. Within the sketch, create a circle with the following properties: * Center: [0.0322, 0.0322] * Radius: 0.0322 Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch. Apply a uniform scale of 0.0645 to the sketch. Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis to a depth of 0.155 to create a cylindrical object with a tapered top and bottom. Finally, combine all the parts to obtain the desired CAD model with a cylindrical shape and a hole in the center, along with vertical ridges along its length.</description>

Note that this sketch contains two faces, each having two loops and two curves (lines or arcs) each. **Extruding the Sketch:** 1. Scale the 2D sketch using the sketch_scale parameter: 0.8024 2. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and translation vector [0.0, 0.1875, 0.0]. 3. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with an extrusion depth towards the normal of 0.1875 and opposite normal of 0.0. The final dimensions of the shape are as follows: - Length: 0.8024 - Width: 0.1875 - Height: 0.8024 Now that you've constructed the base part, you can proceed with building upon it using the specified operations for each subsequent part, mentioned in the CAD Assembly JSON.
